content: On the one hand, I simply cannot see myself going into debt for a sofa (boyfriend can pay for it if he wants it so bad!) — I still don’t have a ‘real sofa’. But on the other hand, if I did need to go into debt, I hope I’d be rational enough to get it interest free from a family member instead of pay interest. Or is that wrong? I’m not sure I wouldn’t use my credit cards first. I guess I’d try my best not to borrow money from anyone who couldn’t afford to ‘lose’ the money. I just couldn’t handle the responsibility/possibility that my loan could cause hardship. In any case, I enjoyed the read.
